deIdi2b2.TEXT:
Record date: 2096-09-09
Cardiac Surgery Consult
Weeks, Kenneth
9/09/96
1205466
CC: 3 days of increased shortness of breath.
HPI:
78 yom s/p 2-cabg on Jul 20, 2096. Had pleural effusions, tapped for 1.5 liter on August 31, 2096, felt better. Was put on Lasix, excreted 28 lbs of fluids. 3 days ago started having increased DOE and SOB. No CP. Now able to walk only 10-15 ft w/o sob. Able to walk up 1 flt of stairs or less. Needs only 1 pillow to sleep at night. Has committed some dietary indiscretions lately (chicken sausage).
No CP, night sweats, chills.
PMH:
Gout
IDDM2
Thrombocytopenia
Atrial Fibrillation
BPH
Chronic Renal Insufficiency
Hypercholesterolemia
Hyperhomocysteinemia
Hypertension
Patent Foramen Ovale (PFO)
Basal Cell Carcinoma
Bursitis,
Coronary Artery Disease,
Labyrinthitis
Squamous Cell Carcinoma
Umbilical Hernia
PSH:
CABG
Bone marrow Biopsy
SCC removed from head 2094
Turp 2086
FH:
Brother s/p stent placement at age 78, CHF
Another brother had diabetes and peripheral vascular disease.
SH:
SMOH: 30 pack yrs; Date quit: 2065
ETOH: Amount: about 10 drinks in his lifetime
No IV drug use.
Occupation: Retired Insurance Claims Examiner for Prudential
Notes: Lives in New Iberia, MN with his wife of 54 years. His wife is in the early stages of
Alzheimers.
Meds:
ATENOLOL 50 MG QAM, 25 MG QPM
ASPIRIN ENTERIC COATED (ASA ENTERIC COATED) 325 MG PO QD
FINASTERIDE (PROSCAR) 5 MG PO QD
FOLIC ACID (FOLATE) 1 MG PO QD
ALLOPURINOL 100 MG PO QD
QUININE SULFATE (QUININE) 325 MG PO QHS
FUROSEMIDE (LASIX) 120 MG PO QD
LORAZEPAM (ATIVAN) 1 MG PO PRN
ATORVASTATIN (LIPITOR) 20 MG PO QD
WARFARIN SODIUM 5 MG QD EXCEPT THU: 7.5 MG
INSULIN NPH HUMAN 15 UNITS SC QAM BEFORE BREAKFAST
AMBIEN 25 MG PO QHS
All: NKDA
PE:
VS: 96.8 153/95 89 18 97% RA
Gen: NAD, A+OX3
HEENT: Multiple AK's on head, lentiginous lesions present. Scar from SCC present at right vertex. JVP 5
Heart: Irreg. Irreg. 2/6 systolic ejection murmur present.
Chest: clear on Right with fine crackles at bases, Loss of breath sounds from midfield down on Left.
ABD: Protuberant, non-distended, non-tender. + shifting dullness. No fluid wave.
Extr: Trace pitting edema on right leg. 2+ pulses
Labs:
WBC 4.6 (4.5-11.0) th/cmm
HCT 33.5 L (41.0-53.0) %
HGB 11.6 L (13.5-17.5) gm/dl
RBC 3.81 L (4.50-5.90) mil/cmm
PLT 142 L (150-350) th/cumm
MCV 88 (80-100) fl
MCH 30.4 (26.0-34.0) pg/rbc
MCHC 34.6 (31.0-37.0) g/dl
RDW 14.0 (11.5-14.5) %
DIFFERENTIAL REQUEST RECEIVED
Diff Method Auto
Poly 65 (40-70) %
Lymphs 21 L (22-44) %
Monos 9 (4-11) %
EOS 4 (0-8) %
Basos 1 (0-3) %
Absolute Neuts 3.01 (1.8-7.7) th/cmm
Absolute Lymphs 0.95 L (1.0-4.8) th/cmm
Absolute Monos 0.39 (0.2-0.4) th/cmm
Absolute EOS 0.20 (0.1-0.3) th/cmm
Absolute Basos 0.04 (0.0-0.3) th/cmm
Aniso None (NORMAL)

Microcytes None
Sodium (Stat Lab) 140 (135-145) mmol/L
Potassium (Stat Lab) 4.7 (3.4-4.8) mmol/L
Chloride (Stat Lab) 110 H (100-108) mmol/L
CO2 (Stat Lab) 27.3 (23.0-31.9) mmol/L
BUN (Stat Lab) 55 H (8-25) mg/dl
Creatinine (Stat Lab) 2.4 H (0.6-1.5) mg/dl
Glucose (Stat Lab) 116 H (70-110) mg/dl
Imaging:
CXR 9/09/96
Moderate left CP angle blunting increasing since previous study
9/11/96. No other change.
EKG:
Low amplitude EKG.
PR interval 200ms, borderline 1st degree AV Block
Impression/Plan:
78 yo male with increased SOB and DOE, with increased left pleural effusion.
1. Coags
2. BS fingersticks qid
3. RISS
4. OK to diurese
5. Consider IR drainage
6. Cardiac Surgery Team will follow
Pt seen with Dr Stone.
Dr Mickey Kyle, DMD, MD
